How the Internet Helps Musicians with CD Replication?

The Internet has reduced the barriers to entry into the music business. Today thanks to the rapid evolution in technology, a musician can record a song and share it with listeners around the world. In the past, distribution was controlled by the record labels. Unless you had a record deal and used CD Replication or CD Duplication it was almost impossible to reach listeners outside of your immediate area.

CD Replication and CD Duplication was not only controlled, but there was no way around the high costs of physical distribution. CD Replication could be prohibitively expensive for the starving artist. However, with free MP3 distribution via the internet, an artist’s music can reach across the world. An up and coming Latin diva can share her tunes with someone in Europe. The next rock star in Africa can share his music with someone in Japan. The Internet has opened a door that allows artists to share their art with anyone, anywhere, at any time.

A custom shaped DVD Card can create even more interest in your campaign. EasyReplication now offers a number of pre-approved shapes for you to select from or you can create a shape that is specifically related to your product or service.

There are basically only two rules when creating a custom shape.

• It must touch at least three points of an 80mm circle.
If the product you would like to represent is not a symmetrical (balanced shape) we can provide suggestions on additional graphics to obtain the shape desired. Capacity will depend upon the smallest measurement from centre and can vary from 150 MB for mini 8cm disc shapes and 720 MB for full size 12cm shapes. Feel free to submit your image for evaluation. There is no fee for this service so why wait? Send your image today.

DVD Replication and mini DVD Replication

Stamping involves mildew for the DVD discs. An injection molding machine uses heated polycarbonate that is injected then briefly cooled before the info from the glass master is etched onto it. Because each disc is made from the same glass master that remains uncorrupted, a replicated DVD is generally of higher quality than a duplicated DVD. Replication also includes adding protecting layers to each disc to preserve the information. Duplication lays down the data on the disc without additional physical protection, leaving it more prone to scratches and pits. CD and DVD duplication is a similar process where the digital data is transferred onto an existing pre-made disc like CDR (Compact Disc Recordable) or DVDR (Digital Versatile Disc Recordable). DVD duplication is ideal for low volume DVD make and for quick turn requirements. Without the need of Glass mastering and longer machine set-up, CD/DVD duplication is affordable than DVD replication and is preferred for small scale distribution.

What Is On Demand DVD Replication?

On Demand DVD Replication or more commonly known as ODCP (On Demand CD-R and DVD-R Publishing) is a process that allows clients to transmit their custom CD/DVD content directly to a dedicated and secure FTP server.

A transaction-processing server prepares the data and then communicates the information to an automated replication robot. On demand DVD Replication simplifies the process. The replication robots master the CD, duplicate it, label it and verify its content. The CD or DVD is then packaged and labelled ready for immediate postal dispatch.

The benefits of On Demand DVD Replication include:

• Priority scheduling with on demand DVD replication
• Rapid turnaround
• No requirement for you to forecast demand
• Eliminates the need to hold and manage expensive stocks
• Contract pricing

Due to high equipment cost and the high level of technical expertise required, few companies can offer this kind of service.

We also provide standard and recycled packaging to suit. easyreplication is amongst the leading suppliers in the UK for CD and DVD based optical media.

Brief Introduction to DVD Replication

DVD Replication provides a cost effective way to produce low volumes of DVD for demonstration purposes. It is important to note this method does not produce a genuine retail quality product. Only DVDs manufactured by replication will provide the shop ready article.

For replication it is common for the minimum production run to be 500 and in some cases 1000. DVD Replication provides the option of lower quantities. It is worth noting however that it can prove more cost effective to replicate – especially if you are likely to require more copies in the future. Costs for DVD Replication remain similar for each time you order whereas replication unit costs are lower. For example if you ordered 200 duplicated DVDs initially and then had a requirement for a further 200 a short time later, the likelihood is it would be far cheaper to replicate 500 or even 1000 at the outset.

DVD Replication, Duplication Difference and mini DVD Replica

Unlike a CD, a DVD consists of two sides made of plastic which are stuck together. These sides are also called layers. Data can be pressed at a far higher density on both layers than on a CD, giving the DVD a considerably greater storage capacity.
DVD duplication is just that-duplicating a program, motion picture or inventive performance onto another DVD so as to share it with someone or to market it commercially. Somebody with a PC and a DVD burner can simply copy a DVD to a blank disc and produce an acceptable copy. This isn't routinely done at home for large amounts because it is very time thorough.

Stamping involves mildew for the DVD discs. An injection molding machine uses heated polycarbonate that is injected then briefly cooled before the info from the glass master is etched onto it. Because each disc is made from the same glass master that remains uncorrupted, a replicated DVD is generally of higher quality than a duplicated DVD. Replication also includes adding protecting layers to each disc to preserve the information. Duplication lays down the data on the disc without additional physical protection, leaving it more prone to scratches and pits. CD and DVD duplication is a similar process where the digital data is transferred onto an existing pre-made disc like CDR (Compact Disc Recordable) or DVDR (Digital Versatile Disc Recordable). DVD duplication is ideal for low volume DVD make and for quick turn requirements. Without the need of Glass mastering and longer machine set-up, CD/DVD duplication is affordable than DVD replication and is preferred for small scale distribution.

The process of Bulk CD replication

Bulk CD replication process features high quality duplicated CDs with 4 colors. It is done on CD silk screening. The companies that are involved in CD duplication use the latest technology and equipment and adhere to strict quality regulations and controls. Since a large number of copies are created during replication, it is not an expensive procedure. The vendor will give you the first duplicated copy of the CD to make sure the quality and get your approval. The first copy is also important because the quality of all the other copies depend on that first copy, instead of the master disc. Not only this, CD Replication service providers usually provide beautiful packages for the CDs. CD replication is a good option especially for the businesses, in which projects have to be worked on with a large number of CDs like five hundred or more and when all the people working on the same project require the same master disc.

Interesting information on bulk DVD replication

Many people may not know this but there is a difference between bulk DVD replication and duplication. To start off, DVD duplication is simply the process of burning data from an original DVD onto another existing DVD recordable disc. Bulk duplication is possible with high quality industrial grade duplicators which can produce formats playable in different DVD players.
On the other hand bulk DVD replication involves the generation of a clone of an original master copy. A glass master is created from the original master and from it a stumper is then created. The stumper is defined as the mirror image of the contents in the DVD. The stumper is then mounted onto a High Tech injection mould machine and in the molding process a replica of the mould is produced on the normal DVD disc which is then coated using a thin layer of reflective aluminum.

DVD replication create hi-definition standard copies

The process of bulk DVD replication is to create hi-definition standard copies from original DVD’s in large volumes. DVDs are recommended more for their picture quality as well as for the storage capacity. DVD’s are always first choice over a CD when it comes to quality viewing. Bulk DVD replication is a difficult process. It’s wise to take professional help. Many replication firms provide a good and affordable price quote for bulk orders while maintaining strict quality controls.

Bulk DVD replication

Bulk DVD replication manufacturing process does not vary much with that of a CD. The dye layers used in the DVDs are the only difference that separates them from CDs. This minor difference is also the only reason which leads to hi-definition viewing in a DVD. DVDs come in various formats like DVD5 which has a single layer of data on one side of the disc and DVD9 which provides two layers of data also on one side of the disc and then comes DVD 10 where we get one layer of data on both sides of the disc. DVD10 is mostly used for bulk DVD replication.

Bulk DVD Replication Process is slightly different from CD R

Bulk DVD replication is the process by which we can create good quality copies from original DVD’s in large quantities. This process is powerful enough to replicate each and every type of DVD’s. It is slightly different from the CD replication process. This bulk DVD replication is the ideal way to get absolute compatibility.

Bulk DVD replication is best for large quantities of DVD’s

Bulk DVD replication is best for those whose business demands more than 500 to 600 or even more quantities of DVD’s. Especially when all the people involved in the project require the same master disc. So the and CD replication process of DVD replication is carried out at that time. This DVD replication and CD replication is a cost effective technology. Bulk DVD replication and Bulk CD replication technology has become a good means of storing data.

Bulk DVD and CD replication manufacturing process

If many copies of a CD are required bulk replication is going to be the preferable choice. This CD replication process is best suited for order of 300 and above discs. Due to the method of manufacture quantities of 300 and above can be replicated more cost effectively than using short run duplication.

The great thing about choosing bulk CD replication is that costs are kept to a minimum and the customer has their own flexibility over packaging options. If you are working to tight budgets then purchasing CD’s bulk on spindles and packing yourself can save valuable pounds. Our factory replicated discs are usually supplied shrink wrapped in spindles of 100 units.

Bulk DVD replication and CD replication also reduces lead times as there is no print or packaging to consider. The discs can come straight off the production lines and be shipped same day. Bulk packed discs are usually turned around in 6-7 working days whereas full packaged products with print take at least 10 days.

CD and DVD duplication are quick and convenient

One needs to be aware of the nature of CD duplication and replication. Replication and duplication are among the most cost effective methods of copying data. There are companies that offer services of CD/DVD replication and CD/DVD duplication. There are many advantages of both procedures. If you need small numbers of discs then you should opt for CD or DVD duplication and if you want larger quantities, then you should go for CD or DVD replication. The cost per unit will go down if the quantity increases, so bulk orders will help you lower your costs. If you are in a business that involves producing video and music products, then it becomes absolutely necessary for them to reach the market on time. This is where the procedure of CD replication and DVD duplication comes in handy. The procedure of CD duplication and DVD replication is perfect for personal as well as business use.

Easyreplication provide best services for DVD replication

DVD/CD replication is commonly used for obtaining CDs that can be given as free gifts with products or services. This is a very cost effective way of increasing the sales of a company or store. CD/DVD replication is also used by several institutions to share and distribute data among a large number of clients. So, make the smart decision and opt for a CD/DVD replication service.

DVD and CD replication produces a reliable disc

The DVD replication and CD replication are very useful in the production of error free discs. This process is very much useful for media and Software companies to satisfy their customers with their high quality of disc as it appears as their master copy. There is no need of compromising with quality. The DVD and CD replication produces a reliable and durable disc than any other. It is cost effective also.

Easy approach to CD replication

There are lots of distinct good reasons as to why one would have to employ a firm for DVD duplication companies. Now this sort of service should not be mixed up with DVD replication and CD replication services. A lot of companies offer both of these services, even so each of these solutions significantly differ from one another. Now when searching for a company to carry out these services you’ll find fairly a couple of points that you ought to search for as a way to ensure which you are finding what you want.

Professional DVD Replication Services

DVD replication is the original method of manufacturing DVDs. DVD replication is different from DVD duplication, which means burning DVDs. Often termed as ‘PRESSING’ or ‘MOLDING,’ DVD replication is process of producing basic DVDs using raw materials in DVD molding machines. Your DVDs get silver look when data or audio is physically stamped on them using the glass master. Usually, aluminum is used to reflect the laser in your DVD player.
